article.headline: Arkansas State 56, South Alabama 54
article.story: MOBILE, Ala. (AP) -- Lorenzo Hampton put back a missed shot with 2.8 seconds left to give Arkansas State a 56-54 win over South Alabama Saturday night. The Jaguars had tied the score at 54-all on Malerick Bedden's 3-pointer with 30 seconds remaining. On the last possession, Arkansas State's Antonio Rambo missed a jumper but Hampton tapped in the shot for the victory. Despite shooting 28.6 percent in the opening half, the Jaguars held a 27-20 halftime advantage. Bedden, who led South Alabama with 16 points, gave the Jaguars their biggest lead at 38-30 when he hit a three-pointer at the 13:16 mark. The Indians answered with a 19-4 run over the next eight minutes to turn an eight-point deficit into a seven-point lead. Dewarick Spencer led the charge by scoring nine of his game-high 21 points. Richard Law and Bedden hit back-to-back 3s to pull South Alabama within 52-50 with 3:14 remaining. A pair of free throws by Spencer pushed the lead to 54-50. Bedden hit one of two free throws to trim the margin to 54-51 with 1:37 left. Arkansas State outrebounded the Jaguars 45-33 and hit 39 percent of their shots. South Alabama finished with 30 percent shooting.
